reviews.title: Well located, good experience overall
reviews.text: This hotel is in a very convenient location, offering excellent tram and train links throughout the city. We found it really easy to get about from it, and ventured out of the central area to the Olympic Park and Dachau with no trouble.

reviews.title: Could Not Recommend for Summer Months
reviews.text: Rooms were a good size (small bathroom but perfectly fine) and very clean and well maintained. It was very quiet during the night - we experienced no outside noise at all. Reception staff were helpful and friendly.

reviews.title: Beat all Expectations
reviews.text: We didn't get breakfast included in our rate and went to the various nearby bakeries instead, for a much better deal! We also got an excellent rate online, so felt as if we had a bargain here!

reviews.title: Good value and convinient location
reviews.text: The guest rooms were very comfortably decorated, however the insinuation that air-conditioning is available is ludicrous. The sixth floor room was stifling, no fans were available and the windows were inconvenietly located to provide ventilation. The staff did not assist in any way as we arrived by car and the front entrance and elevator were very inconvenient for large, heavy bags. These were our first three nights of a seventeen day stay in Germany, and we were very disappointed and uncomfortable. We should have moved on.

reviews.title: Cannot Beat the Location
reviews.text: This is a great hotel. The location is the best part of it. The staff were courteous. The room was good with a very comfortable bed. Will definitely go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here the first week of May and it's a really charming hotel. The rooms are decorated in a cute traditional style with paintings and canopy beds. Our room was really comfortable and nicely decorated; great shower too.
reviews.title: Fantastic , centrally located hotel

likes.liked: — cute decor and a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is fantastic - it's right by a major train station and walking distance to most of the major city sights.
reviews.title: What a wonderful hotel

reviews.text: The staff was incredibly helpful. They were great about giving directions and translations, and when I caught a bad cold in the middle of my trip, they helped us find a late-night pharmacy.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

likes.liked: — clean. well kept room in central location
likes.disliked: — breakfast not included in the rate I paid; my fault I guess

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's also a really nice breakfast buffet with a lot of variety of hot and cold items.
reviews.title: Great for the Christmas Market

likes.liked: — Sumptuous pillows and a great night's sleep!

reviews.text: A very nice hotel and I would stay there again anytime I visited Munich.
reviews.title: Best Hotel on Our European Vacation

likes.liked: — the friendly staff and inviting rooms

reviews.text: Chose this hotel as it was one where breakfast was included in the rate.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good staff, but.....
Nice but high priced
reviews.text: Very easy to find from the central station and both trains that go to the airport stop there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at 2, but couldn't check in till 3. The info provided by Lastminute.com was generic. No probs, left bag in cupboard behind reception, but it is not secure so anyone could walk out with your case. Don't leave valuables there.
reviews.title: A Rare Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got back around 6 and were taken too our rooms - in the annexe. If you get given a key as opposed to card, you are going to the annexe which is out the back of the car park. You have a separate entrance that is used by other businesses in this block including a martial arts centre and some religious group. We had to go up to the 1st floor (no lift) where the hotel has about 10 rooms. There rooms don't have airconditionion, but thankfully as we were there in Dec heating was required. It was off when we went into the room.
reviews.title: Delightful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What first hit me was the smell of tobacco. It was vile. I asked for another room but they were full. We had to leave the windows open while we were out to get rid of the smell. I also had to buy a can of odour neutraliser as well. This worked thankfully.
reviews.title: Loved it

likes.disliked: — Meal was not included in the room rate

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights in Sept. Lobby was nicely decorated. Room was pretty and of a good size. Bathroom was tiny but served its purpose. Staff was friendly and accomodating and very child friendly (gave my 3yr old little gifts at breakfast). Breakfast buffet was the best we experienced in our 2 wks in Europe: eggs/bacon/huge cereal bar, meats, cheeses, pastries, yogurt, fruit, etc etc. Neighborhood wasn't very exciting but there were a few internet cafes across the street and a 10 min walk or so to the Marienplatz. Had a nice meal at the Lowenbrau bier garten (make a left out of the hotel and walk about 7 minutes--its a huge castle like place you can't miss). We found Germans (Bavarians) to be wonderful and extremely child friendly. We'd stay at the Kings Hotel again if we ever return to Munich--it was a great value!
reviews.title: Good value & location

likes.disliked: — Wish the immediate neighborhood was more interesting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is only a five minute walk from the railway station and close enough to the centre of the city to walk to most of the main attractions. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms of a high standard. The breakfast room and choice of food were excellent. Unfortunately we did not make use of the sauna facilities. For the price paid this hotel is excellent value and we would definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

likes.liked: — Quality of room, breakfast and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a nice hotel with friendly staff and wonderful decorated room, which was extremely clean. Service was friendly and helpful. Lavish American breakfast with scrambled eggs, sausages, large variety of cereals, different sorts of bread etc, etc. The hotel is very conveniently located, just 15 Min. by foot to Marienplatz (absolute center with lot of shops, pedestrian area) and only 5 Min. to the Museum quarter (if you like modern art: Lenbach-House and modern pinakoteque are a must). Central station is also only some minutes away. Had a nice stay there, can recommend it.
reviews.title: Good Service!

reviews.text: The hotel has a good location, five minutes walk from the train station but you have to ask where it is when you get off the station. After this first impact it is easy to find it. The area is safe. the hotel is clean but the rooms are small. The best this hotel can offer is its easy reach from the station and the proximity to the city centre, which can be reached on foot.
reviews.title: A good hotel near the city centre

reviews.text: Very attractive hotel, with excellent access to public transport (under 5 min. walk to Hauptbahnhof and to trams and tour buses next to the station). Rooms at the back very quiet though tram noise in front rooms. Breakfast very good, with excellent presentation and wide choice though rather expensive (however, cafes nearby. Closed on Sundays though so try the station cafes).
reviews.title: Smart hotel, good value, excellent location
